column4: is there a way to downgrade an installation of something on ubuntu? I tried going to the packages.ubuntu.com to grab them manually, but it's down, is there a better way through apt-get?
yes, you'll have to add the repository and force version
I'm not familiar with doing that, say I wanted the most recent openssh-client/server before the newest one, what would I have to do?

Synaptic > Settings > Repositories > third party software.  Then once you search for sshd, you'll find older versions, you can then right click force version...  I haven't personally done this before.  Usually if I need a specific version of something I'll just get the deb/source and compile it
